alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Cheshire; Eastern Hillsborough; Merrimack; Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 17 at 2:58PM EDT until June 17 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following areas, Androscoggin, Central Interior Cumberland, Central Somerset, Coastal Cumberland, Coastal Waldo, Interior Cumberland Highlands, Interior Waldo, Interior York, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Northern Franklin, Northern Oxford, Sagadahoc, Southern Franklin, Southern Oxford and Southern Somerset. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following areas, Belknap, Cheshire, Eastern Hillsborough, Merrimack, Northern Carroll, Northern Coos, Northern Grafton, Southern Carroll, Southern Coos, Southern Grafton, Sullivan and Western And Central Hillsborough. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Low pressure will bring periods of heavy rain and some thunderstorms to the forecast area the rest of the day into tonight. Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Smaller creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A general 1 to 3 inches of rain is expected to fall the rest of today into tonight with locally higher amounts possible, before rain starts to taper off overnight. Highest amounts are expected in the mountains. However, south of the mountains, slower moving showers and thunderstorms may develop and also pose a risk for flash flooding, especially in normally prone urban areas. Hikers and campers should keep a close eye on the weather and be alert to any subsequent statements or warnings.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
